title.narrative: Justice for All: Enhancing Accessibility, Fighting Impunity

description.narrative: The objective is to promote an equitable access to justice and its efficient enforcement for all citizens in general and poor and disadvantaged people, including women, children, minorities, indigenous peoples, and human rights and social activists, in particular.

description.narrative: Reported results indicators by the European Commission ¿ International Cooperation and Development (DEVCO) may not represent the complete set of indicators monitored for the project. The results are reported using a contribution approach. This means that where a project has been financed by the EU jointly with other funders ¿ such as partner country governments or other donors ¿ the overall outputs of the collective effort are reported rather than outputs attributed to the share of funding provided by the EU. For higher levels of results, such as outcomes and impacts, the project will only have contributed to the overall effort.

title.narrative: Status of Training Videos for Capacity Building of Tanod* and the Lupon Tagapamayapa** in handling Violence Against Women Cases, Children in Conflict with the Law (CICL) and Children At Risk (CAR) cases._x000D_ [*A barangay tanod, also known as a barangay police officer is the lowest level of law enforcement officer in the Philippines] and a ** Lupon Tagapamayapa is a neighbourhood dispute settlement committee without judicial powers]_x000D_
